alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 2:33AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Douglas and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lawrence, Baldwin City, Eudora, Wellsville, Lecompton, Lone Star, Pleasant Grove and Vinland.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
